name: Inn at 202 Dover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in a lot of B&B's but this one tops the cake. Everything was perfect. The rooms are simply gorgeous and very spacious. The owners made us feel at home. The vodka tasting were a particular highlight. Gourmet breakfast included but do not miss dinner at the gourmet restaurant site (only open Thursday to Sunday). Have a five star dinner at 3 star prices.
reviews.title: Curl up in luxury and relax

reviews.text: A wonderful spot for an anniversary trip. A romantic getaway. The themed rooms are beautiful and much more than what we were expecting. Whenever we left the room for the day or even just for dinner downstairs the staff would turn down the bed and leave cookies or cakes for our return.
reviews.title: Extremely elegant and exceeds expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are very accommodating and present, always asking how you are enjoying your stay.
reviews.title: Superb and can't wait to go back!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the safari suite, which was our favorite, but the English and French suites were absolutely beautiful as well.
reviews.title: Best Place Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The story of the renovation is very interesting and you should hear it, as well as flip through the photo album in the front sitting room.
reviews.title: Beautifully renovated, wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I meant to write this review immediately upon return. The Inn is absolutely lovely and Shelby and Ron have put a great deal of care and planning into its design. They are charming hosts and work to make everyone feel welcome. The restaurant is
reviews.title: Perfect Weekend spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: worth a trip, even if you aren't staying at the inn. My husband and I definitely want
reviews.title: We loved it ane we'll be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to return and have recommended it to all our friends!
reviews.title: A great romantic getaway!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Inn at 202 Dover is a pricey but totally worth it extravagance. Shelby and Ron were the general contractors for the renovation of a beautiful but somewhat derelict mansion and have resurrected the bones of a great old house and then taken it to the next level with all the comforts of a great old residence and then added all the not so little nuances of really comfortable beds and great bathrooms and AIR CONDITIONING- i know everyone has air conditioning now a days but; working it thoughtfully into an old residence is a trick and they have played that trick. So the food is fabulous, Easton is a wonderful old,working, real town, and totally worth visiting.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Inn at 202 as a birthday celebration for my husband. We were pleasantly surprised to find such a gem just a short commute from Northern Virginia. This is a beautiful B&B. The property is exquisitly landscaped and the rooms are spacious and luxorious. My husband has done a lot of travelling and he said it was the best room he had ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Romantic, Stylish, and Luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at this Inn for our Anniversary, it was our first time to the Easton, St.Michaels area, and we already can't wait to visit again. The Inn at 202 Dover was such a great place to stay. It was elegant, clean, comfortable, the owners were so friendly, and they made an awesome breakfast. We stay at alot of B&B's and this was by far our favorite with the best breakfast. We stayed in the Victorian room, and were fully satisfied with it. It was a beautiful room. We only stayed one night, but we were able to visit shops and sightsee in Easton and St. Michaels both during those two days. We also had a great dinner at St. Michael's Streak and Crab House. We will be booking this room again the next time we visit the area and have already recommened it to family and friends!
reviews.title: Peaceful Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not a regular bed and breakfast patron, however I have been to one before. This Inn was beautiful and charming, very well decorated and had great amenities, and wonderful history. The food was delicious and the cookies at bed time were a particularly nice touch. The vodka tasting was wonderful, I learned a lot about vodka. As someone who does not drink a lot, Ron made me feel comfortable and taught me a lot. I hear they have ladies nights sometimes for vodka and wine tastings, that sounds like fun!
reviews.title: A beautiful Inn Close to DC
A first rate B&B in a charming, luxurious setting
reviews.text: There is very little I would say that is negative about that Inn. If I could give it 4.5 stars I would. I would say, that at times I felt like a bit awkward in the small and cozy public areas of the inn: the library, the sitting room, when they were being used by others. But the suites were spacious and nicely decorated. The steam shower was absolutely fabulous!

If I had occasion to be in the area again I would gladly stay here again if i had the funds to get a suite. The prices, while good for an Inn of such quality, are still on the higher side if it isn't for a special occasion.
reviews.title: Beautiful comforts with attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful romantic weekend at the Inn at 202 Dover. On Friday evening we attended a vodka tasting, presented by the host, which was informative and fun. Our suite was beautiful and luxurious, and the restaurant was first rate.
reviews.title: Peacock Restaurant - Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Inn at 202 Dover on a Friday night to celebrate our anniversary. We were impressed with the elegant and lovely building, public areas, and rooms (all except ours are suites). We were in the Victorian room, which is nice enough but fairly small (though the bathroom is big)--unlike the huge and beautiful suites that we saw, the Victorian was not a room we would want to spend a lot of time in other than for sleeping. I think the price of the room--$279 plus tax--is a little high, but the suite prices were much higher so the Victorian seemed like a relative bargain. If we were going to stay more than one night I would definitely want to stay in a suite.
reviews.title: lovely and welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom had an air jet tub (which my husband tried and liked) and rain shower combination. There was good water pressure, and thick towels and robes were provided. One thing that would have been nice to have is a nightlight in the bathroom, because I didn't like having to turn on the bright light in the middle of the night.
reviews.title: A Truly Memorable Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the thoughtful amenities of the inn is a communal drinks and snack area with water and soda in the fridge and all kinds of hot drinks to make with the machine (a Tassimo, I think), as well as granola bars, chips, etc. Water bottles are in your room, and they put chocolate cookies in the room while we were out.
reviews.title: Beautiful on all counts, and well worth the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The innkeepers, Ron and Shelby, are welcoming, helpful, and interesting to talk to.
reviews.title: A Luxurious place to stay with great hosts and delicious food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a delight eating breakfast in the sunny enclosed porch /dining room, and Ron made a delicious hot cocoa for me (I had mentioned my preference for cocoa or tea when we reserved the room). There is also a beautiful Victorian conservatory next to the dining room. They serve dinner at the inn also but we did not eat there. The night we were there they were hosting a rehearsal dinner, which was pretty loud, but they left between 10 and 11 and it was quiet after that except for a couple of people slamming room doors when they came in later and also when they went out early Saturday morning.
reviews.title: Perfect Romantic Anniversary Getaway

description: The Inn at 202 Dover is Easton's inn of distinction. It has been described as the "Buckingham Palace of Inns." This Victorian mansion is located in the downtown Historic District. The Inn is distinctive, comfortable and elegant. Luxurious suites, each with a different theme, with air-jet tubs, steam showers, European linens, Internet access and evening turn-down service. Gourmet breakfast served each morning. The restaurant serves dinner to guests and the public, Thursday - Monday.
